title: All the places the army has sent me...
name: All the places the army has sent me...
description:
A Map by Kevanc

These are all the places the army has sent me... PCS, TDY, deployment, etc.

properties.name: Advanced Camp
properties.description: Posted by KevancI attended ROTC Advanced Camp at Fort Bragg, NC during the summer of 1993. It\'s been a long time. But, I believe this is the spot where our old World War II-era barracks were located.

properties.name: Airborne School
properties.description: Posted by KevancÂ This is the barracks I lived in during my first Army training. I attended Airborne school in July 1991. I was assigned to D/1-507th PIR. They were temporarily being housed in these barracks.

properties.name: Camp Atterbury, IN
properties.description: Posted by KevancI\'ve spent more time than I care to remember at this place. It\'s the local training area to Indiana. I have been there for several training events, conferences, drill, mobilize, demobilize, you name it...

properties.name: Columbus, IN
properties.description: Posted by KevancThe Columbus Holiday Inn seemed to be a popular place to hold conferences in the late 1990\'s.

properties.name: Fort Harrison, IN
properties.description: Posted by KevancI participated in many ROTC field training exercises, physicals, records management, etc. at Fort Harrison. Those training exercises were held in these woods. Land navigation, Ranger FTX, etc.

properties.name: Fort Knox, KY
properties.description: Posted by KevancI\'ve been to Fort Knox several times for various things... physicals, field training exercises, etc. It\'s the closest active duty military post to my duty station.

properties.name: Fort Leavenworth, KS
properties.description: Posted by KevancI have attended a few Brigade Command and Battle Staff Training\'s (BCBST) and a Division Warfighter at Fort Leavenworth between 1996 to present.

properties.name: Fort Polk, LA
properties.description: Posted by KevancBetween 1998 and 2000, I participated in the Leader\'s Training Program (LTP) and Joint Readiness Training Center (JRTC) rotations. When at Fort Polk, eat in Leesville at Catfish Junction or Wagon Master... They\'re the only places to eat.

properties.name: Fort Stewart, GA
properties.description: Posted by KevancWhile an aide-de-camp, we travelled to Fort Stewart in the fall of 1999 to observe training. It was the first time I visited the Savannah, GA area.

properties.name: Nashville, IN
properties.description: Posted by KevancI attended a couple conferences held at the Four Seasons Hotel in Nashville, IN during the late 1990\'s.

properties.name: Officer Basic Course
properties.description: Posted by KevancI attended Air Defense Artillery Officer Basic Course at Fort Bliss, TX during the first half of 1996. I lived in the BOQ marked by the flag.

properties.name: Oklahoma City, OK
properties.description: Posted by KevancWhile working as an aide-de-camp, I attended a conference in Oklahoma City during the summer of 2000.
